ratings.question_text: How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-10, if you wish
comments: The seminar series of the class is very enjoyable and informative.

1) The first half of the course would have benefited from having readings available that matched lecture topics, even if just chapters from Pielou's A Naturalist's Guide to the Arctic.9) An incredible trip and set of field opportunities! So thankful for having the opportunity to participate.
The field trip to Newfoundland.
The wide variety of the student topics allowed me to learn about many different subjects incrementally each week.
Graeme and Anne's stories about their Arctic and Alpine experiences.

The subject material! Am fascinated by these ecosystems and therefore the class was an excellent fit.The amazing trip to Newfoundland and the incredible people who took us out into the field during the trip.

narratives.question_text: The things about this course most in need of improvement are:
comments: The second half of the course should be scheduled in advance, so that students know when they are presenting several weeks ahead of time.Would appreciate one class dedicated to taxonomy of species that we expect to see on the field tour.Was disappointed that several students only spottily attended the second half of the semester, which consisted of student presentations. For this reason alone might want to reconsider restructuring the second half of the course, because I think it brought the morale down.

narratives.question_text: What was the availability and quality of help you received of the instructor and TA?
comments: Both the TA and the instructor were always available to help students, and did an excellent job of it.
Both the instructors and TA were extremely helpful and available throughout the entire semester.
Dylan was very helpful and made time to conduct reviews for the midterm.
Sufficient/average.

narratives.question_text: Discuss if you wish how this course fits into your overall program.
comments: I want to do research in boreal forests moving forward in my career, making this class perfect for my interests.
Related to climate change over time, I'm interested in environmental en vegetational changes at geological time scales.

I hope to work in all three types of these ecosystems at some point in my career, so this course provided me with the specialized knowledge I'd like to have in order to be confident working in these systems.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: Matched well with my interests
Topic related with my research area of interestCuriosity
This was actually my 'fun' course for the semester, as it teaches topics I'm highly excited about and I was keen to experience the field tour.

narratives.question_text: Did it live up to your expectations?
comments: Yes.
Yes
Yes
Yes! This course was a bright spot in my course schedule.

narratives.question_text: Did you get out of it what you expected?
comments: Yes.
Absolutely
Yes
Yes.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Nothing toshow..

narratives.question_text: For students taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Pick a topic that excites you and will remain interesting after multiple weeks of presentations

Pick a topic for the paper and presentations that you're excited about, because it will make it easy to prepare engaging presentations and write a good paper.Make sure to carve out time to attend the field tour.Attend the second half of the course! Support your fellow students!Read Pielou's A Naturalist's Guide to the Arctic. It's an excellent read and goes over a lot of the lecture material in more detail.
